volumeInfo.description: Business Principles and Management will help your students meet the challenges and opportunities of a rapidly evolving business world. The topics students need to know to manage and operate a business, finance, marketing, communications, human resources, and more are all incorporated. This text builds a solid foundation of established principles and practices, then shows students how to apply these principles and practices in the dynamic business world.

volumeInfo.title: Executive EQ
volumeInfo.subtitle: Emotional Intelligence in Business
volumeInfo.description: There's more to success than having a high IQ - emotion plays its part too. Emotional Intelligence (EQ) is increasingly being adopted as an essential management skill. EQ consists of five key dimensions: knowing one's emotions; controlling ones emotions; recognizing emotions in others (empathy) controlling emotions in others; and self motivation. This book provides practical guidelines and examples on how to use EQ to enhance personal and corporate performance.

volumeInfo.title: The IEBM Dictionary of Business and Management
volumeInfo.description: The IEBM Dictionary of Business and Management is an easy-to-use A-Z of over 7500 key management terms, acronyms and abbreviations compiled from the prestigious IEBM Encyclopedia of Business and Management. This invaluable reference source is an essential companion for students on business and management, MBA and professional courses, managers and practitioners by providing a handy insight into the often bewildering terminology of the modern international business world.

volumeInfo.title: Harvard Business Review on Managing Through a Downturn
volumeInfo.description: When the economy stalls, your job as a manager gets tougher. Employees often withdraw, becoming more concerned with survival than breaking new ground. But talented managers know that lean times provide opportunities for innovation, fresh thinking, and, surprisingly, growth. How do the most resilient leaders and organizations survive--even thrive--during a market slowdown? Use this collection of HBR articles to not only weather tough times, but rise to the challenge. The series is designed to bring today's managers and professionals the fundamental information they need to stay competitive in a fast-moving world. From the preeminent thinkers whose work has defined an entire field to the rising stars who will redefine the way we think about business, here are the leading minds and landmark ideas that have established the Harvard Business Review as required reading for ambitious businesspeople in organizations around the globe.

volumeInfo.title: New Traditions in Business
volumeInfo.subtitle: Spirit and Leadership in the 21st Century
volumeInfo.description: A fundamental transformation--what many are calling a "paradigm shift"--is underway today in our business and work world. This book brings together paradigm thinking in business. Writers such as Peter Senge and William Miller focus on transforming business toward greater emphasis on meaningful work, spiritual values, social responsibility, and visionary leadership.

volumeInfo.title: The Business Models Handbook
volumeInfo.subtitle: Templates, Theory and Case Studies
volumeInfo.description: Benefit from a reliable collection of the most valuable business models, including detailed coverage of each model, expertly explained theory, as well as case studies and supporting templates.

volumeInfo.title: China’s Intellectual Property Regime for Innovation
volumeInfo.subtitle: Risks to Business and National Development
volumeInfo.description: This book evaluates the risks that China’s intellectual property (IP) regime poses to innovation. China's IP regime has been heavily criticized as potentially stifling innovation. However, the country’s innovation capabilities have risen significantly and major reforms have recently been made to its IP regime. How risky, really, is China's IP regime for innovation? This book investigates this question at different units of analysis based on a multidisciplinary assessment involving law, management, economics, and political science. Specifically, it critically appraises China's substantive IP laws, measures for boosting patent quantity and quality, measures for transmitting and exploiting technological knowledge, new experimental IP measures, and China's systems for administering and enforcing IP. Practitioners and scholars from various backgrounds can benefit from the up-to-date analysis as well as the practical managerial tools provided, including risk assessment matrices for businesses and recommendations for institutional reform.

volumeInfo.title: Business Environment
volumeInfo.description: This book explores the managerial roles and responsibilities with regard to safety. Applying key legal requirements to the workplace, it looks at how workplace facilities are managed and how materials and equipment are used, stored and maintained for optimum effectiveness. It not only aids organisations to achieve success, but to maintain it.

volumeInfo.title: Business Spanish Dictionary
volumeInfo.subtitle: Spanish-English, English-Spanish
volumeInfo.description: English/Spanish, Spanish/English dictionary of business terms.

volumeInfo.title: The Business Mindframe
volumeInfo.subtitle: The General Truth of Business Redefining Business Management Knowledge
volumeInfo.description: Essentially, our system serves as a frame of mind in the field of business, called Business "MindFrame", in which people can be aided in better modeling business contexts, reasoning the business decisions out, and charting the effective courses of actions rationally. Published by SCPG Publishing Corporation and distributed by World Scientific for all markets except China.

volumeInfo.title: Perspectives on Business Modelling
volumeInfo.subtitle: Understanding and Changing Organisations
volumeInfo.description: One of the key issues presented here is bridging the communication gap between business leaders and IT experts in companies and public services. This is facilitated by combining different models for the development of corporate strategies, business processes and information support. The leading idea behind this book is to present different perspectives on business modelling, based on established theories and practical experiences. It thus offers advanced knowledge and relevant information on the key issues in business modelling for today's organisations.

volumeInfo.title: Eurasian Business Perspectives
volumeInfo.subtitle: Proceedings of the 28th Eurasia Business and Economics Society Conference
volumeInfo.description: This book gathers selected theoretical and empirical papers from the 28th Eurasia Business and Economics Society (EBES) Conference, held in Coventry, United Kingdom. Covering diverse areas of business and management in various geographic regions, it highlights the latest research on human resources, management and marketing, among other topics. It also includes related studies that address management and marketing aspects such as telecommuting versus the traditional work environment, the effect of value congruence, promoting product characteristics using social media, perception of terrorism risks, and personal innovativeness and employability.

volumeInfo.title: Cybercrime
volumeInfo.subtitle: Leadership Styles in Small Businesses
volumeInfo.description: Researches the connection between leadership style and cybercrimes in small businesses.

volumeInfo.title: Winning - The Answers
volumeInfo.subtitle: Confronting 74 of the Toughest Questions in Business Today

volumeInfo.title: The Managers' Guide To Getting Control Of Your Business
volumeInfo.subtitle: A Series Of How-to, Hands-on Procedures For Effectively Handling Management Issues
volumeInfo.description: The Managers' Guide to Getting Control Of Your Business guides business managers through systematic processes to achieve results. The exercises included help the manager establish recognition by others as a pro-active, goal-driven, principle-centered leader. Learn how to apply proven business principles to develop and implement appropriate strategies. By completing the Action Items at the end of each chapter the manager will: Gain experience in executing a plan Transition from a reactive to a pro-active mode of behavior carve out "time" to focus on those issues that accomplish measurable results

volumeInfo.title: Open Business Innovation Leadership
volumeInfo.subtitle: The Emergence of the Stakeholder University
volumeInfo.description: Within a complex environment, change is endemic to survival and the dynamic capability to continuously learn becomes a critical success factor. In this perspective, this book offers guidance for value creation and for the development of intellectual capital within networks of individuals and organizations.

volumeInfo.title: When Family Businesses are Best
volumeInfo.subtitle: The Parallel Planning Process for Family Harmony and Business Success
volumeInfo.description: The authors explore how effective planning and communication helps business families around the world address growth challenges as they strive to become high performing multi-generation family enterprises. This book shows family businesses working together at their best.

volumeInfo.title: Family Businesses’ Growth
volumeInfo.subtitle: Unpacking the Black Box
volumeInfo.description: Growth is one of the central strategic topics in management science. A growing enterprise embodies success and growth supports the longevity of the business. In her book Laura Seibold provides an overview of the literature on general growth components and different theoretical growth models with a special focus on family enterprises. The author formulates a comprehensive model of how growth can be achieved in family firms. This derived model combines the insights from general growth theory, family specific literature and the insights of top family firm leaders.

volumeInfo.title: The Palgrave Handbook of Research Design in Business and Management
volumeInfo.description: The Palgrave Handbook of Research Design in Business and Management uses a new state-of-the-art research design typology model to guide researchers in creating the blueprints for their experiments. By focusing on theory and cutting-edge empirical best-practices, this handbook utilizes visual techniques to appease all learning styles.

volumeInfo.title: The Phenomenal Power of Business Intelligence
volumeInfo.subtitle: Managerial Skills for the 21st Century
volumeInfo.description: In this digital age, information is pivotal to organizations. This book aims to raise awareness of the need to radically change management styles to fit with the new patterns of working in the 21st century. Each chapter provides ideas and discussion around a particular subject area and closes with an assessment of the skills that are required by managers in order to manage situations in a creative and dynamic way. Case studies are also used to enable the reader to consider different ways in which management skills can be applied to business situations.
